Description: Pottery mould-made lamp. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with a rosette. Shoulder shows, between bands of small circles and of raised points, a retrograde Greek inscription. Nozzle-top shows three longitudinal ridges. Pointed oval base-ring, with spine to nozzle. Brown clay, with mica covered with a red-brown slip.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Faras (Nubia), cemetery 4 grave 39 (made in Aswan)
Curator's comments: Found with cup as 'Liverpool AAA' xiv, 1927, pi. lx, 12. Same Series, but not Aswan fabric: Säve-Söderbergh, T., 1981. ‘Late Nubian cemeteries’. New York : Scandinavian University Books, pL. 15, 3, from Serra, near Faras, from a grave dated ad 550 - 600. Bibl. 'Liverpool AAA' xiv, 1927, p. 73.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2224)
Buckton 1994 / Byzantium: Treasures of Byzantine art and culture from British collections (no.121, p. 110-111)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007 9 Mar-3 Sept, Belgium, Musee Royal de Mariemont, 'Pharaons noirs Sur la Piste des Quarante Jours'
